query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 O insensata cura de’ mortali, 2 quanto son difettivi silogismi 3 quei che ti fanno in basso batter l’ali!
query.error: **English:** 1 O senseless eagerness of mortals, 2 how defective are the reasonings 3 that make you beat your wings downward!
query.result: 1 O diboesek delaneth an dusow, 2 pyth yw an argumensow difektyv 3 ow th'aga thueth why dhe wals dhe'n esel!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Chi dietro a iura e chi ad amforismi 5 sen giva, e chi seguendo sacerdozio, 6 e chi regnar per forza o per sofismi,
query.error: **English:** 4 One goes after laws and another after medical aphorisms, 5 and one, following the priesthood, 6 and one to rule by force or by trickery,
query.result: 4 Nebes yw wosa an lejyow ha'n amforysmow, 5 ha nebes yw wosa an ofis a'n ofyern, 6 ha nebes yw wosa ren y'n dreus dre nerth po sofysmow,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 e chi rubare e chi civil negozio, 8 chi nel diletto de la carne involto 9 s’affaticava e chi si dava a l’ozio,
query.error: **English:** 7 and one to steal and one to engage in public affairs, 8 one toils, caught up in the pleasures of the flesh, 9 and one gives himself up to idleness,
query.result: 7 ha nebes yw wosa ladron ha nebes yw wosa negos sivil, 8 nebes yw wosa'n pleser a'n kig yw strifya, 9 ha nebes yw wosa'n dileys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 quando, da tutte queste cose sciolto, 11 con Bëatrice m’era suso in cielo 12 cotanto glorïosamente accolto.
query.error: **English:** 10 when, freed from all these things, 11 with Beatrice I was welcomed up into heaven 12 so gloriously.
query.result: 10 pan, diworth pub tra ma oas esa, 11 gans Bees gwrello dhe'n nef esa dhe'n esel 12 yn-dann mor a vri yw kemerys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Poi che ciascuno fu tornato ne lo 14 punto del cerchio in che avanti s’era, 15 fermossi, come a candellier candelo.
query.error: **English:** 13 After each one had returned to the 14 point of the circle where he had been before, 15 he stood still, like a candle in a candlestick.
query.result: 13 Wosa pubonan oas dywrys dhe'n 14 poynt a'n kelgh yn-nans oas, 15 ev a sevas, kepar kanedhel yn kandelyer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 E io senti’ dentro a quella lumera 17 che pria m’avea parlato, sorridendo 18 incominciar, faccendosi più mera:
query.error: **English:** 16 And I heard within that light 17 that had spoken to me before, smiling 18 begin, becoming brighter:
query.result: 16 Ha my a glewas y'n-dann an goleudh na 17 ow th'eth leverys dhe'm yn-nans, ow mosogha, 18 ow talleth, ow tos ha bos moy gleudh:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 «Così com’ io del suo raggio resplendo, 20 sì, riguardando ne la luce etterna, 21 li tuoi pensieri onde cagioni apprendo.
query.error: **English:** 19 “Just as I shine with its radiance, 20 so, looking into the eternal light, 21 I learn the causes of your thoughts.
query.result: 19 “Kepar ha'm a splann gans y sklerder, 20 kepar henna, ow tos dhe'n goleudh sempeternel, 21 y'th boesow a fedhys my a dhyskas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Tu dubbi, e hai voler che si ricerna 23 in sì aperta e ’n sì distesa lingua 24 lo dicer mio, ch’al tuo sentir si sterna,
query.error: **English:** 22 You doubt, and you want my speech, 23 in such clear and ample language 24 that it may sink into your understanding,
query.result: 22 T'eth dowt, ha t'eth kar dhe vos leverys 23 yn yeth kler ha leun avel henna 24 ow leverel vy, dhe'th vos kevys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 ove dinanzi dissi: “U’ ben s’impingua”, 26 e là u’ dissi: “Non nacque il secondo”; 27 e qui è uopo che ben si distingua.
query.error: **English:** 25 to be explained where I said before: “Where one fattens well”, 26 and where I said: “The second was not born”; 27 and here it is necessary to distinguish well.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 La provedenza, che governa il mondo 29 con quel consiglio nel quale ogne aspetto 30 creato è vinto pria che vada al fondo,
query.error: **English:** 28 Providence, which governs the world 29 with that counsel in which every created 30 aspect is overcome before it reaches its end,
query.result: 28 An ragdres, ow th'a lyw an bys 29 gans an keusel na, yn-nans pub tra 30 a veu kreyys yw gorrys kyns ev dhe vos dhe'n diwedh,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 però che andasse ver’ lo suo diletto 32 la sposa di colui ch’ad alte grida 33 disposò lei col sangue benedetto,
query.error: **English:** 31 so that the bride of him who with loud cries 32 betrothed her with his blessed blood 33 might go to her beloved,
query.result: 31 rag dhe vos dhe'n kar an gwreg a'n neb 32 a'n dysposas gans lefow uhel 33 gans y wos benygys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 in sé sicura e anche a lui più fida, 35 due principi ordinò in suo favore, 36 che quinci e quindi le fosser per guida.
query.error: **English:** 34 secure in herself and even more faithful to him, 35 ordained two princes in her favor, 36 who would be her guides on either side.
query.result: 34 yn-dann seur dhe hyn ha moy fydhek dhe'n, 35 deus priñs a ordenas yn y favr, 36 ow th'aga dhe hyn ha dhe'n keth dhe vos y lywydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 L’un fu tutto serafico in ardore; 38 l’altro per sapïenza in terra fue 39 di cherubica luce uno splendore.
query.error: **English:** 37 One was all seraphic in ardor; 38 the other, for wisdom on earth, was 39 a splendor of cherubic light.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 De l’un dirò, però che d’amendue 41 si dice l’un pregiando, qual ch’om prende, 42 perch’ ad un fine fur l’opere sue.
query.error: **English:** 40 Of one I will speak, because of both 41 one is praised when speaking of the other, as one takes, 42 because their works were to one end.
query.result: 40 A'n eyl henna a leveraf, rag a'n dew 41 yth leverir an eyl aral owth leverel, kepar ha neb a gymmer, 42 rag dhe unn fin oas aga oberow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Intra Tupino e l’acqua che discende 44 del colle eletto dal beato Ubaldo, 45 fertile costa d’alto monte pende,
query.error: **English:** 43 Between Tupino and the water that descends 44 from the hill chosen by the blessed Ubaldo, 45 a fertile slope of a high mountain hangs,
query.result: 43 Ynter Tupino ha’n dowr a zisken 44 a’n bre owth eth dewisys gans an gwen Ubaldo, 45 un kos fertile a ughel menydh a wrapp,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 onde Perugia sente freddo e caldo 47 da Porta Sole; e di rietro le piange 48 per grave giogo Nocera con Gualdo.
query.error: **English:** 46 from where Perugia feels the cold and heat 47 from Porta Sole; and behind it Nocera and Gualdo weep 48 because of the heavy yoke.
query.result: 46 le may Perugia a dheuth poes ha tomm 47 a Porta Sole; ha y’n keth le may Nocera ha Gualdo 48 a wela rag an iow lourek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Di questa costa, là dov’ ella frange 50 più sua rattezza, nacque al mondo un sole, 51 come fa questo talvolta di Gange.
query.error: **English:** 49 From this slope, where it breaks 50 its steepness most, a sun was born into the world, 51 as this one sometimes does from the Ganges.
query.result: 49 A’n kos ma, le may hi a wrapp 50 moy y rattedh, genys oas dhe’n bys un howl, 51 kepar ha hemma a wra a-ugh Gange.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Però chi d’esso loco fa parole, 53 non dica Ascesi, ché direbbe corto, 54 ma Orïente, se proprio dir vuole.
query.error: **English:** 52 Therefore, whoever speaks of that place, 53 should not say Assisi, for that would be short, 54 but Orient, if he wants to speak properly.
query.result: 52 Rag henna, neb a wra leverel a’n le may, 53 na levero Ascesi, rag henna a vydh byghan, 54 mes Orïente, mar kar leverel yn-dann voyla.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Non era ancor molto lontan da l’orto, 56 ch’el cominciò a far sentir la terra 57 de la sua gran virtute alcun conforto;
query.error: **English:** 55 He was not yet very far from the garden, 56 when he began to feel the earth 57 give some comfort from its great power;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 ché per tal donna, giovinetto, in guerra 59 del padre corse, a cui, come a la morte, 60 la porta del piacer nessun diserra;
query.error: **English:** 58 for such a lady, as a youth, he went to war 59 for his father, for whom, as for death, 60 no one unlocks the door of pleasure;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 e dinanzi a la sua spirital corte 62 et coram patre le si fece unito; 63 poscia di dì in dì l’amò più forte.
query.error: **English:** 61 and before his spiritual court 62 and coram patre he united himself to her; 63 then day by day he loved her more strongly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Questa, privata del primo marito, 65 millecent’ anni e più dispetta e scura 66 fino a costui si stette sanza invito;
query.error: **English:** 64 She, deprived of her first husband, 65 for more than a thousand years, scorned and obscure, 66 remained without an invitation until he came;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 né valse udir che la trovò sicura 68 con Amiclate, al suon de la sua voce, 69 colui ch’a tutto ’l mondo fé paura;
query.error: **English:** 67 nor did it avail her to hear that he found her safe 68 with Amiclates, at the sound of his voice, 69 he who made the whole world afraid;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 né valse esser costante né feroce, 71 sì che, dove Maria rimase giuso, 72 ella con Cristo pianse in su la croce.
query.error: **English:** 70 nor did it avail her to be steadfast and fierce, 71 so that, where Mary remained below, 72 she wept with Christ upon the cross.
query.result: 70 na'th omdhiskwedhes bos bos hi dhe vos konstant ha ferowgh, 71 hemma, pan wrug Mari man dhe'n nor, 72 hi a wrug kewsel gans Krist war an grows.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Ma perch’ io non proceda troppo chiuso, 74 Francesco e Povertà per questi amanti 75 prendi oramai nel mio parlar diffuso.
query.error: **English:** 73 But so that I may not proceed too obscurely, 74 take now in my diffuse speech Francis and Poverty for these lovers.
query.result: 73 Mes rag na vynnaf mos mos dhe'n clos, 74 Fransis ha Boverta rag an amansow ma 75 kemer a-dhyworth ma dhe'n lavarow treus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 La lor concordia e i lor lieti sembianti, 77 amore e maraviglia e dolce sguardo 78 facieno esser cagion di pensier santi;
query.error: **English:** 76 Their concord and their joyful countenances, 77 love and wonder and sweet gaze 78 made them a cause of holy thoughts;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 tanto che ’l venerabile Bernardo 80 si scalzò prima, e dietro a tanta pace 81 corse e, correndo, li parve esser tardo.
query.error: **English:** 79 so much so that the venerable Bernard 80 first went barefoot, and after such peace 81 he ran and, running, seemed to himself to be slow.
query.result: 79 Kemmys oedh an venytha' Bernerd 80 a-dhallath kyns dhe vos, ha wosa henna peth 81 ef a redhas ha, pan oedh ef ow redha, ef a dhewis bos dhe vos a-bell.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Oh ignota ricchezza! oh ben ferace! 83 Scalzasi Egidio, scalzasi Silvestro 84 dietro a lo sposo, sì la sposa piace.
query.error: **English:** 82 O unknown riches! O fertile good! 83 Giles goes barefoot, Sylvester goes barefoot 84 after the bridegroom, so pleasing is the bride.
query.result: 82 O richedhow an-wonys! O da bara dowr! 83 Egidius a-dhallath dhe vos, Silvester a-dhallath dhe vos 84 wosa'n priodas, hemma an priodas a-lowen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Indi sen va quel padre e quel maestro 86 con la sua donna e con quella famiglia 87 che già legava l’umile capestro.
query.error: **English:** 85 Then that father and that teacher goes away 86 with his lady and with that family 87 that the humble cord already bound.
query.result: 85 Wosa henna an tas an tas ha'n mester 86 gans y wraig ha gans henna an teulu 87 a veu kevys gans an capester isel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Né li gravò viltà di cuor le ciglia 89 per esser fi’ di Pietro Bernardone, 90 né per parer dispetto a maraviglia;
query.error: **English:** 88 Nor did the baseness of his heart weigh down his brow 89 for being the son of Pietro Bernardone, 90 nor for seeming wondrously despised;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 ma regalmente sua dura intenzione 92 ad Innocenzio aperse, e da lui ebbe 93 primo sigillo a sua religïone.
query.error: **English:** 91 but he royally revealed his steadfast intention 92 to Innocent, and from him he received 93 the first seal for his religious order.
query.result: 91 mes avel brenin ef a-dhiskwedhas y enter a-bell 92 dhe Innocentius, ha gans ef ef a-gavas 93 an kynsa sel dhe'y relijon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Poi che la gente poverella crebbe 95 dietro a costui, la cui mirabil vita 96 meglio in gloria del ciel si canterebbe,
query.error: **English:** 94 After this man, whose wondrous life 95 would be better sung to the glory of heaven, 96 the poor people grew in number,
query.result: 94 Wosa henna an bobel bover a-gorhas 95 wosa henna, y vewnans a-veu moy gwell 96 dhe vos kanys yn gloria an nef,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 di seconda corona redimita 98 fu per Onorio da l’Etterno Spiro 99 la santa voglia d’esto archimandrita.
query.error: **English:** 97 and the holy desire of this archimandrite 98 was crowned with a second crown 99 by Honorius from the Eternal Spirit.
query.result: 97 gans an nessa kurun ef a-veu kurunys 98 gans Honorius a'n Spyrys Eterna 99 an dhesyr sans a'n archimandrita ma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 E poi che, per la sete del martiro, 101 ne la presenza del Soldan superba 102 predicò Cristo e li altri che ’l seguiro,
query.error: **English:** 100 And after that, for the thirst of martyrdom, 101 in the presence of the proud Soldan 102 he preached Christ and the others who followed him,
query.result: 100 Ha wosa henna, rag an syth a'n merter, 101 yn presens an Soldan sur, 102 ef a bregethas Krist ha'n erel a'y sewya,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 e per trovare a conversione acerba 104 troppo la gente e per non stare indarno, 105 redissi al frutto de l’italica erba,
query.error: **English:** 103 and because he found the people too stubborn for conversion 104 and so as not to stay there in vain, 105 he returned to the fruit of the Italian soil,
query.result: 103 ha rag kavos an bobel marowgh dhe dhiskwedhes 104 ha rag na vos dhe vos ow tos dhe omdhiskwedhes, 105 ef a-dhiskwedhas dhe frooth a'n erva italek,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 nel crudo sasso intra Tevero e Arno 107 da Cristo prese l’ultimo sigillo, 108 che le sue membra due anni portarno.
query.error: **English:** 106 and on the harsh rock between the Tiber and the Arno 107 he received from Christ the final seal, 108 which his body bore for two years.
query.result: 106 war an garrek krev dhe vos ynter Tever ha Arno 107 a Krist ef a-gavas an sel diwettha, 108 henna a'y esel a-berthas y esel dhe vledhen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Quando a colui ch’a tanto ben sortillo 110 piacque di trarlo suso a la mercede 111 ch’el meritò nel suo farsi pusillo,
query.error: **English:** 109 When it pleased him who had granted him so much good fortune 110 to draw him up to the mercy 111 that he merited by making himself humble,
query.result: 109 Pandho dhe'n huni a gevas kemmys da ben sortillo 110 pygas dhe'n dreha dhe'n suso dhe'n veres 111 a'y merytas yn y'i furvy pusillo,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 a’ frati suoi, sì com’ a giuste rede, 113 raccomandò la donna sua più cara, 114 e comandò che l’amassero a fede;
query.error: **English:** 112 to his brothers, as to just heirs, 113 he commended his dearest lady, 114 and commanded that they should love her faithfully;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 e del suo grembo l’anima preclara 116 mover si volle, tornando al suo regno, 117 e al suo corpo non volle altra bara.
query.error: **English:** 115 and from his lap his glorious soul 116 wished to depart, returning to its kingdom, 117 and for his body it wanted no other bier.
query.result: 115 hag a'y grembo an enef preklara 116 movas a vynnas, tornans dhe'n y'i rynos, 117 hag dhe'n y'i korf ny vynnas erel bara.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Pensa oramai qual fu colui che degno 119 collega fu a mantener la barca 120 di Pietro in alto mar per dritto segno;
query.error: **English:** 118 Think now who was worthy 119 to be a colleague to keep the boat 120 of Peter on the high seas by the right sign;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 e questo fu il nostro patrïarca; 122 per che qual segue lui, com’ el comanda, 123 discerner puoi che buone merce carca.
query.error: **English:** 121 and this was our patriarch; 122 therefore whoever follows him, as he commands, 123 you can discern that he carries good merchandise.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Ma ’l suo pecuglio di nova vivanda 125 è fatto ghiotto, sì ch’esser non puote 126 che per diversi salti non si spanda;
query.error: **English:** 124 But his flock, with new food, 125 has become greedy, so that it cannot be 126 that it does not spread out through various pastures;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 e quanto le sue pecore remote 128 e vagabunde più da esso vanno, 129 più tornano a l’ovil di latte vòte.
query.error: **English:** 127 and the more his sheep, far and wide, 128 and wandering, go further from him, 129 the more they return to the fold empty of milk.
query.result: 127 ha'gas moy y'n davasow pell 128 ha vagas moy a-dhiwedhes a'n mos, 129 moy a wra'th dhe'n crows gansal gwag.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Ben son di quelle che temono ’l danno 131 e stringonsi al pastor; ma son sì poche, 132 che le cappe fornisce poco panno.
query.error: **English:** 130 I am indeed one of those who fear harm 131 and huddle close to the shepherd; but there are so few of us, 132 that the cloaks are scantily supplied with cloth.
query.result: 130 Yn-mes o onan a-dredh an colledh 131 ha'gas streyn orth an mester; mes yns i a-lemmyn, 132 marnas an kappennow a wra gansal byghan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Or, se le mie parole non son fioche, 134 se la tua audïenza è stata attenta, 135 se ciò ch’è detto a la mente revoche,
query.error: **English:** 133 Now, if my words are not feeble, 134 if your hearing has been attentive, 135 if what has been said recalls to your mind,
query.result: 133 Lemmyn, mar nyns yw fiog ow lavarow, 134 mar oedh ow klevva brys, 135 mar a wra leverys dhe'n poynt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 in parte fia la tua voglia contenta, 137 perché vedrai la pianta onde si scheggia, 138 e vedra’ il corrègger che argomenta
query.error: **English:** 136 in part your desire will be satisfied, 137 because you will see the plant from which the splinter comes, 138 and you will see the correction that argues
query.result: 136 y'n rann a fia ow holon lowen, 137 rag yth gwelsy an plansa wosa yma'n skell, 138 ha'gas gwelsy an keverel a wra leverel

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 “U’ ben s’impingua, se non si vaneggia”».
query.error: **English:** 139 “One fattens well, if one does not indulge in vanity”».
query.result: 139 “Yn ta dhe vras, mar nyns yw folleth”».
